x10.matrix.comm

Class MatrixRingCast

  • x10.matrix.comm.MatrixRemoteCopy
    • x10.matrix.comm.MatrixRingCast

  • public class MatrixRingCast
extends MatrixRemoteCopy
    Ring cast sends data from here to a number of places .

    It starts with sending data from here to the first place in the list, and from the first place to the second place in the list, and so on until the end of list.

    This operation is implemented for SUMMA matrix multiplication, when places in the same partition row (or column) use the same block of matrix data as the first operand (or the second) in matrix multiply.

        mpiRingCast
        

        protected static void mpiRingCast(x10.array.DistArray<DenseMatrix> dmlist,
               x10.lang.Int datCnt,
               x10.array.Array<x10.lang.Int> plist)
        

        Declaration: mpiRingCast(dmlist:x10.array.DistArray[x10.matrix.DenseMatrix]{self.dist.region.rank==1},datCnt:x10.lang.Int,plist:x10.array.Array[x10.lang.Int]{self.rank==1}): void.
        Send data of dense matrix from here to a list of places using
MPI send/recv routines. Note, the root place (place here) must be
in the list. The root place ID may appear multiple times in the
the list to speed up the performance. However, it also may increase
network contentions.
        

        Parameters:
        dmlist - duplicated storage for copies of dense matrix in all places
        datCnt - count of data to send
        plist - the list of place IDs. Root place must be in the list

        Parameters:

        Ring cast sends data from here to a number of places
.

         It starts with sending data from here to the first place in the list, and from the first place
to the second place in the list, and so on until the end of list.


         This operation is implemented for SUMMA matrix
multiplication, when places in the same partition row (or column) use
the same block of matrix data as the first operand (or the second) in matrix
multiply.
